title.narrative: Addressing the Critical Dignity and Menstrual Hygiene Needs of Women and Girls of Reproductive Age

description.narrative:
The overall objective of the project is to address critical gaps in dignity and menstrual hygiene management needs of women and girls of reproductive age in the northeast Nigeria response with a focus on MMC, Ngala and Monguno. It will facilitate a standardized but context-specific approach to the development and distribution of dignity kits.
The specific objectives of the project include Procurement/sourcing and management of the pipeline for standardised dignity kits to meet the needs of women and girls of reproductive age. Strengthen coordination for standardisation and maintaining oversight on sourcing, procurement, distribution and Post Distribution Monitoring (PDMs)
This project prioritizes the development of content-specific dignity kit and plans that include the implementation of common standards for development and distribution. UNFPA will be the main pipeline management agency, working closely with national and international partners to ensure smooth running of the project as well as its sustainability. The following underpins the key aspects of the project activities Meet the immediate, lifesaving dignity needs of women and girls of reproductive age by providing a standardised kit/package. Localised approach: When possible, local procurement is preferred. An assessment will be made of the availability and reliability of local capability before sourcing from outside the area. Empowerment: The project is considering dignity kit production and assembly as a potential income-generating activity for women and girls affected by conflict. Women and girls will be trained in production of some key items and will also be involved in the assembly process. Engagement of national civil society organisations through participating in the Dignity kits task force and/or consortium. A well-coordinated approach: from sourcing, assembly, distribution and post distribution monitoring, to avoid duplication of services, ensure the most vulnerable are prioritised, set and uphold quality standards.
The target locations for this project will be MMC, Ngala and Monguno LGAs. 11,000 direct beneficiaries will be reached by UNFPA and a total of 31,000 beneficiaries will be targeted by the project in general through the UNFPA facilitated coordination. A component of the project will be implemented directly and through national civil society partners Rehabilitation Empowerment and Better Health Initiative and Zenith of the Girls Child and Women Initiative Support.
